entry.title: Recap of October | Apache Answer
entry.summary: October brings an award and community love.
entry.content:
Hope you enjoyed the spooky vibe of the Halloween. Hereâ€™s your October newsletter filled with chilling delights!

ğŸ«¶ Communityâ€‹

New award coming! We have received the award of cutting-edge open source projects and communities presented by China Communications Standards Association. Apache Answer has impressed the judges with its strong community, global reach, and technical flexibility, as shown in the preliminary round and the second round of interviews.

The community gets bigger! Give it up for our new committer: Qirui Song. He contributed a lark notification plugin and shared his notes in his blog.

Besides, he also helped with bug fixes and code quality improvement. Weâ€™re so glad to have such a versatile and active person joining the family.

OSPP goes well so far. Our mentors have reviewed the merged PR/MR from the students and wait for the final evaluation from the committee.

Coming up Nextâ€‹

1.4.1 is now in the voting process and will be released in November. Have a sneak peek for the new version.

ğŸ¤² Got Something in Mind?â€‹

Whether itâ€™s a suggestion, bug report, or a question, you can always share it in our official Q&A community. Letâ€™s make the future Q&A platform software better.

entry.title: Recap of September | Apache Answer
entry.summary: September is for fun.
entry.content:
As the leaves swirl with the gold in the autumn wind, itâ€™s the final quarter of the year. Time to do a quick recap of this season.

ğŸŒŸ Whatâ€™s Newâ€‹

Apache Answer more features and stable performance in the latest 1.4.0.

Show the Badges: Show off your achievements with our new badges system. Earn badges for active participation, valuable contributions, and more!

Discover Your Personalized Feed: Get a tailored experience with our personalized feed, which recommends posts based on your interests and past interactions.

Code Highlight with Ease: Make your code snippets stand out with our enhanced code highlighting plugin. Customize the appearance and readability of your code.

Ready to upgrade? Hereâ€™s how.

ğŸ«¶ Communityâ€‹

The coding and development phase of OSPP is complete. Both the students have submitted their PRs and are waiting for the mentorâ€™s final review. Well done!

ğŸ™Œ Cheers to Contributorsâ€‹

Shout out to to kumfo, robinv8, LinkinStars, shuaishuai, sosyz, sy-records, IamMelody233, CHENJUaaa, SantiagoLiendro, ferrischi201.

Special thanks to lehoa.strong for effort on translation and approval!

ğŸ¤² Talk to Usâ€‹

Feedback wanted! Contributors wanted! Feel free to connect with us via X, Discord, or in the community.

entry.title: Answer 1.4.0: Where Fun Meet the Content You Love
entry.summary: Answer adds badges and personalized feed for better engagement and experience.
entry.content:
The wait is over, time to upgrade your knowledge sharing experience.

We celebrate your firsts and the good content with the badges. Explore the content in Recommend where we curate the list based on your following tags and questions. Donâ€™t forget to pick a theme to highlight your code snippets whether for an answer or a question.

Badges: Celebrate and Showcaseâ€‹

Your dedication and contribution deserve to be seen. In our latest update, we've introduced three new badge types to recognize your achievements:

  • Getting Started: For those firsts in the community.
  • Community: For accepted answer.
  • Posting: For shared valuable questions and answers.

Want to see all the badges and ways to earn it? Just look to the left sidebar and click on any badge to learn more about its requirements and see who else has unlocked it.

You can see the badges you earned by clicking the Badges on your profile page.

Managing badges becomes handful for admins. Go Admin page and click Badges where you can check all the active badges. Hit action to choose the badges for your community.

Personalized Feed: Discover the Content You Loveâ€‹

Our new personalized feed is here to change the endless scrolling. We pay attention to your following tags and questions. Based on that, we curate a personalized list of posts that we think you'll find engaging and relevant.

Click Recommend and start exploring your personalized feed we tailored for you.

Code Highlighting Plugin: Let the Code Shineâ€‹

Admins, itâ€™s time to elevate the code readability with the latest plugins. Try render and code highlighting plugins.

Donâ€™t forget to choose a preferred theme to suit community style and make code visually appealing.

We also addressed several bugs, including issues with mobile reactions, HTML source code, deleted answers, test cases, plugin conflicts, and subdirectory deployments.

Letâ€™s Say Thank Youâ€‹

Wow, we had 10 contributors in this release! The biggest gathering! Salute to kumfo, robinv8, LinkinStars, shuaishuai, sosyz, sy-records, IamMelody233, CHENJUaaa, SantiagoLiendro, ferrischi201.

We Love Your Thoughtsâ€‹

We're eager to hear your feedback on this latest release. Did you find new features that have enhanced your experience? Are there any areas where you'd like to see improvements?

entry.title: Recap of August | Apache Answer
entry.summary: August adds new contribution.
entry.content:
As the days grow shorter and the nights cooler, here comes the newsletter of August. Time to recap the new release, fresh features, and give big hugs to the contributors.

Let's go!

ğŸŒŸ Whatâ€™s Newâ€‹

We brought the heart of bringing smoother Q&A experience in every release for more people. In the latest 1.3.6, we introduced two CDN plugins for fast loading speed and pre-filled forms for helping users to stay concentrated on editing the content. Learn more about the details and how-to tutorials in the blog as well as optimizations carried in the release.

Say Hi to Answer 1.3.6: Faster and Easier
This update brings features and improvements designed to enhance both user experience and loading speed.

New Tutorial: Setup and Pluginâ€‹

Besides new features, we also received three new blogs from the community, covering configuration and plugin tutorial.

We understand that it can be challenging for developers to set up the environment with Developer Guides. Now, it gets easier, simply following the blogs with step-to-step configuration and installation guide for both frontend and backend.

Apache Answer Backend Configuration Guide
Answer backend configuration step-by-step guide.
Answer Frontend Configuration Step-by-Step Guide
Answer frontend configuration step-by-step guide.

Thatâ€™s not it. You can also follow another guide on adding plugins to make Answer powerful for your community.

Guide to Adding Plugins to Apache Answer
Learn how to easily add Apache Answer plugins and extend its functionality.

New Translationâ€‹

The new tutorial above supports both Chinese and English. Besides, there're updates for localization. Now, you can explore the Chinese version for Introduction and Getting Started.

If you are willing to join the localization family, don't hesitate to join us. Find out how to get started here.

ğŸ«¶ Communityâ€‹

We put together our preparation and observation from the events we joined in the blog. Feel free to refer to it and get ready for your next big event.

Reflection and Our Tips for Your Next Open-Source Events
Discover how we showcased our open-source project on the world stage, and tips for your next big event.

ğŸ™Œ Cheers to Contributorsâ€‹

Thank you for making the features, shining the tweaks, and fixing the bugs. kevin, kumfo, hgaol, robin, LinkinStars, dashuai, and Luffy.

We would also love to extend sincere gratitude to the hero behind the new tutorial and localization IamMelody233.

ğŸ¤² We Want Youâ€‹

In Answer community, we sing for the good deeds. Besides coding and localization, your feedback also matters. Feel free to connect with us via X, email, or in the community.

entry.title: Say Hi to Answer 1.3.6: Faster and Easier
entry.summary: This update brings features and improvements designed to enhance both user experience and loading speed.
entry.content:
New version for a new release. In 1.3.6, we focus on user experience and performance. Whether you're managing a bustling community forum or building a custom Q&A solution, Answer 1.3.6 empowers you to create a more intuitive and efficient platform for everyone involved.

Upgrade now, and find out what weâ€™ve got for you.

Whatâ€™s Newâ€‹

Pre-fill Forms: Focus on the Content. Leave the Rest.â€‹

Introducing pre-fill forms, a feature that improves data accuracy and more concentration. By allowing you to pre-fill question fields with relevant information, you can significantly reduce user input and improve data accuracy.

Itâ€™s useful for: Frequently asked questions: Pre-fill common question tags. Customer support: Provide essential context for support tickets.

Follow the steps to build a pre-fill form for community members.

  1. Add pre-fill information to the filed for the users.

    ---
    title: How to deploy Apache Answer
    tags: discussion
    ---
    How to deploy Apache Answer?

  2. Encode at https://www.urlencoder.org/

  1. Copy and paste the encoded string with your Answer URL.
  2. Share it with your community members.

CDN Plugins: Speed it up!â€‹

Speaking of performance, Answer 1.3.6 offers two new CDN plugins: Amazon CloudFront and Aliyun CDN. By integrating these plugins into your infrastructure, you can dramatically improve load times and enhance overall user experience. These plugins are by your side for handling increased traffic and faster content delivery.

Take a Look at the Optimizations that Mattersâ€‹

We support username and email update before, and now changing display name is possible for admin. In Admin panel, click Users. Then, hit Action and Edit profile.

We changed the checkbox to toggle button, providing a more intuitive way of responding to your question.

Search bar says goodbye to loneliness with an icon.

To the Contributors!â€‹

We owe a huge debt of gratitude to the feature constructor, improvement maker, and bug hunter who contributed their time and expertise to make this release possible, and they are:

kevin, kumfo, hgaol, robin, LinkinStars, dashuai, and Luffy.

Join the Conversationâ€‹

We believe that every contribution makes a real difference, leaving your feedback to us is a way to contribute. Reach us at our Q&A community, social media, and Discord.

entry.title: Reflection and Our Tips for Your Next Open-Source Events
entry.summary: Discover how we showcased our open-source project on the world stage, and tips for your next big event.
entry.content:
July was a month filled with community and connection. We had the privilege of participating in two incredible events: WeAreDev World Congress 2024 and CommunityOverCode Asia 2024.

We were grateful to be given these chances. In this blog, we would love to share tips here for more open-source projects showcasing themselves on the stage next time.

WeAreDev World Congress GitHub Open Source Spotlightâ€‹

As worldâ€™s leading event for developers and tech decision-makers, WeAreDev World Congress welcomes more than 15,000 developers and over 500 speakers sharing their expertise and visions of future trends in modern software development.

This year, GitHub Open Source Spotlight was a part of this congress. We submitted our application and were chosen and offered a space at GitHub booth. It was an unbelievable opportunity to showcase Apache Answer to a global audience of over 15,000 developers and tech leaders. Not to mention, with other brilliant open-source projects.

The event provided a valuable opportunity to showcase Answer to potential users, contributors, and industry experts. We gained valuable insights and feedback that will help us shape Answer in a better way. Guess what, we even met several users from Germany!

CommunityOverCode Asia 2024â€‹

CommunityOverCode (formly known as ApacheCon) is the official global conference series of The Apache Software Foundation (ASF). Since 1998 â€“ before the ASFâ€™s incorporation â€“ ApacheCon has been drawing participants at all levels to explore "Tomorrowâ€™s Technology Today" across 300+ Apache projects and their diverse communities. CommunityOverCode showcases the latest developments in Apache projects and emerging innovations through hands-on sessions, keynotes, real-world case studies, trainings, hackathons, and more.

We had a booth and 3 speeches in keynote, incubator, and community track. We were happy to catch up with our mentors. At the booth, our committers were grateful to connect and answer questions with committers from other Apache projects.

Tips for Better Showcasing Your Projects Eventsâ€‹

Here, we would love to share some tips for more open-source projects to prepare and show their projects in their next big event.

Share on Social Mediaâ€‹

Make the best use of social media to extend the reach, especially for global community members. Send an event preview, schedule, and invitation to your followers to drop by and connect.

During the event, greet, share the location, and tell them youâ€™ll be staying in the coming days on social media. Check out how our open-source neighbor Open Feature did on day 1 of the congress.

Show Your Project with a Demoâ€‹

In GitHub Open Source Spotlight area, we were offered a table with space for a laptop and keyboard connected to a display.

A live demo is invaluable, and Meta Answer is the demo already. We ran Meta Answer directly for visitors to explore and we can respond to their questions or record suggestion during the process.

If thereâ€™s no connected display on the booth, feel free to bring a portable display, or simply run it on your laptop.

Prepare Some Takeawaysâ€‹

While the demo is a live experience for the visitors, prepare takeaways for them to recall your project. Flyers and several stickers are efficient.

Flyers can provide a quick overview of your project. You can include highlights, social media accounts, and fun facts on the flyers. Stickers are a fun way to leave a lasting impression, and a way to promote your product on the surface of a laptop.

Rushing for our flight, we left a "help yourself" note with our flyers and stickers.

You can also make pins, badge, or mug based on the budget. In CommunityOverCode 2024, the fridge magnets at GreptimeDB booth were a delight by the look and value.

Jot Down the Notesâ€‹

Listen and record questions, suggestions, and feedback. Categorize and share it with the community. Ask community members to discuss or leave the answers, and vote for the best answers. Gradually, you will have a FAQ list for your next event so that whoever participates the conference can prepare in advance for the questions.

Sounds familiar, right? Answer is a great tool for this.

See You on Stageâ€‹

We hope these tips help your open-source project shine at the next big event. Remember, it's all about making meaningful connections and showcasing the value you bring to the developer community.

Participating in these events was unforgettable for our team, and we're excited to continue contributing to the open-source ecosystem.

Please don't hesitate to reach out to us through our social media or our community.

entry.title: Recap of July | Apache Answer
entry.summary: July was a month all about community love.
entry.content:
Another page turns, and it was a busy month with some petit milestones. We made a new release, unlock a new event, and headed to a big gathering with the community. Here's the recap:

ğŸŒŸ What's Newâ€‹

New version released on the beginning of a month. In this update, both users and admins have more freedom to customize, express, and view in the online community with new features. Have you tried the latest 1.3.5? If not, here's the portal.

Apache Answer 1.3.5: Flexibility. Reaction. Extension.
Answer introduces parameterizable base paths, reactions, and embed plugin for a more thriving community.

Our PPMC member shuaishuai released a blog on how to package Answer plugins with a step-to-step tutorial. Easy package plugin from today.

How to Package and Deploy Answer Plugins
Follow this step-by-step guide to package plugins for your Answer.

ğŸ«¶ Communityâ€‹

Letâ€™s give applause to our two new committers sy-records and hgaol! Welcome on board, and you must have seen them in features, bugs fixing, and even docs. Weâ€™re so honored to have them joining the family.

We made a debut at GitHub Open Source Spotlight at WeAreDevelopers World Congress in Berlin. It was lovely to meet other open-source friends, and guess what, we met some of our users!

Big thanks to GitHub for letting us make a big footstep and share our story to more developers.

As an Apache incubating podling, how can we miss the community gathering? Yes, we also joined CommunityOverCode Asia 2024

It was a lovely 3-day event! We made our several firsts â€” Keynote and speeches at 2 tracks. We were lucky to be nourished by the community, and we wanted to give back by sharing our lessons and story during first Apache release and spread the ideas of various contributions.

ğŸ™Œ Cheers to Contributorsâ€‹

Meet and give your applause to the secret heroes!

Features architect: hgaol, LinkinStars, shuaishuai
Improvement maker: sy-records
Bug fixer: byerer, sy-records, robinv8, nayanthulkar28, hgaol, nayanthulkar28, hgaol

Cheers for the time and effort.

âœŒï¸ Coming up Nextâ€‹

New version 1.3.6 is on the way, waiting for the votes. Interested in helping us with the release? Give it a go following the post below.

https://answer.apache.org/community/how-to-release

ğŸ¤² Share Your Ideasâ€‹

We love ideas, especially from you. Tell us how you like the project, and

entry.title: Apache Answer 1.3.5: Flexibility. Reaction. Extension.
entry.summary: Answer introduces parameterizable base paths, reactions, and embed plugin for a more thriving community.
entry.content:
What a nice way to start this July strong with the new version! This is perhaps our very first time to release a new version in the very beginning of a month.

In this update, both users and admins have more freedom to customize, express, and view in the online community with new features. Find out how and why.

Customize URLs with Base Path Parametrizationâ€‹

Time to personalize your Answer URL. You can now handle Answer website address by adding tags to URLs. Itâ€™s a great improvement for both the flexibility and ease of deployment for Answer.

Express Your Attitude with Reactionsâ€‹

When you come across a question that aligns perfectly with your confusion, or a brilliant answer that wipes away your doubts, simply show your appreciation with the latest reaction.

Better Content Showcaseâ€‹

We heard your call, and here we are. Now, knowledge sharing is at the next level with a new embed plugin. It helps to refer to relevant article, tutorials, coding snippets, etc.

After activate the embed plugin, you can customize the title with a brief summary of the content, and then paste the URL of the content you are adding.

It looks like this. Better than multiple cold links, right?

Click here for using plugin tutorial.

Tweaks and Fixesâ€‹

Weâ€™ve made changes to the Active list to ensure it shows current and engaging posts. Old questions will be moved out automatically that are either created 180 days ago, or not received a new answer in the past 90 days. Now, your Answer always shows the most recent topics and discussion when clicking Active.

We understand the need for an easy email address update. Users can now request their email address to be updated through a simple process involving contacting an admin.

Issue such as invalid link, incomplete display, and incorrect count are all fixed! If you spot a bug, donâ€™t hesitate to report it here.

Hereâ€™s to You. Amazing Contributors!â€‹

We couldnâ€™t have done it without the dedication and hard work from the community. This release is brought to you by eight fantastic contributors, including two new faces that we are thrilled to have them here.

Cheers to kumfo, hgaol, robinv8, LinkinStars, shuaishuai, sy-records, nayanthulkar28, and byerer.

Got a Time for Feedback?â€‹

Weâ€™re always open for ways to make Q&A platform better. Do you have any ideas to share? Head over to our SourceForge and rate us stars or leave a review. Thank you so much!

entry.title: Recap of June | Apache Answer
entry.summary: An official farewell to the first half year of 2024 as the curtain of June falls.
entry.content:
As the curtain of June falls, we officially farewell to the first half of the year of 2024. Here's a quick look of our June, and a quick peek at July.

ğŸŒŸ What's Newâ€‹

We were featured in the ASF project spotlight blog and connected to more open-source lovers. In this blog, we shared how we started our journey, mission, use cases, and ways you can join us.

ğŸ«¶ Communityâ€‹

Our PPMC member Nadia brought us to Community Over Code Europe held in Slovakia. She shared useful tricks for raising the community engagement with Apache Answer including insights on enhancing knowledge sharing, leveraging Answer for effective knowledge retention, and utilizing reputation and privilege systems in online communities.

We were lucky to have 2 selected student for our first yearâ€™s OSPP. Our mentors shuai and LinkinStar are ready to add some open sauce to make this summer memorable.

âœŒï¸ Coming up Nextâ€‹

Our next big release 1.3.5 entered the voting process, and it just passed the vote. Click here for the new release details.

This July, Apache Answer will have 2 sessions in Community over Code Asia 2024. Our PPMC members LinkinStar and Anne will share our first Apache release and ways to engage your users.

ğŸ¤² We're All Here for Youâ€‹

Calling Answer enthusiasts here. Show your Answer or tell us your advice to us via social media, the forum, or drop us an email.

entry.title: How to Search Like a Pro in Answer
entry.summary: Learn and make the best use from the search basics to the advanced tips in Apache Answer.
entry.content:
Discussions are always going in Apache Answer. How can you find the information you need in all these conversations? Try to search! Answer provides ways for you to search the information you need, and letâ€™s equip you with all the search tips.

Search Barâ€‹

The search bar locates at the top of every page. Whether youâ€™re browsing on the homepage, or taking a closer look at a post, you can always type and search for the content you require.

Start from a Keywordâ€‹

Just like a search engine, letâ€™s start searching in Answer with a single keyword. Then, you can refine your search by making it to a phrase or sentence. In Answer, we highlight the key terms so that you can identify it with just a glance.

You can also sort the results with Active, Newest, Relevance, and Score to better hunt down the content you need.

Search with Tagâ€‹

Remember the magical tag that play a big role in organizing the community? Theyâ€™re powerful for tracking the content. If youâ€™re looking for content in the same category, searching with a relevant tag is a productive way to start with.

Simply type the tag name inside square brackets and hit search, e.g., [Release].

Advanced Search Tipsâ€‹

Besides keyword and tags, Answer provides multiple ways to search to meet your needs.

  • Search by author with: user:username
  • Find unanswered questions with: answers:0
  • Look for a post with a score with: score: score number
  • Find a question/answer with: is:question or is:answer

Donâ€™t panic if you forget the rules. The advanced search tips are displayed on the right side whenever youâ€™re searching.

You can also combine the search rules together to hunt the exact content down.

We Love to Hear from Youâ€‹

Itâ€™s always nice to have feedback and advice. If you have feature requests, bug report, or show your Answer. You are welcome to reach out on X, Discord, GitHub, Meta Answer, or our mailing list.

entry.title: Install and Run Apache Answer on Ubuntu VPS
entry.summary: This article provides a guide for how to install and run Apache Answer on Ubuntu VPS.
entry.content:
What is Apache Answer?â€‹

Apache Answer is a Q&A platform that helps teams build communities and share knowledge. It can be used as a help center, community forum, or knowledge management platform. Apache Answer is open source and incubates at Apache Incubator.

Prerequisitesâ€‹

This guide assumes the following prerequisites are met:

  • Ubuntu Focal 20.04 (LTS) or Ubuntu Jammy 22.04 (LTS) fresh install
  • Root-level user access

Install and Run Apache Answer on Ubuntu VPSâ€‹

To install and run Apache Answer on Ubuntu VPS, follow the steps below:

  1. Install Docker Engineâ€‹

    1. Login via SSH as root user.

    2. Update and upgrade system:

      sudo apt-get update -y && sudo apt-get upgrade -y

    3. Remove existing Docker files by running the following command:

      for pkg in docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc; do sudo apt-get remove $pkg; done

    4. Install Docker Engine latest version with:

      curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh
      sudo sh get-docker.sh

  2. Install Docker Composeâ€‹

    1. Run the following command:

      sudo apt-get install docker-compose-plugin

    2. Verify that Docker Compose is installed correctly by checking the version:

      docker compose version

  3. Install Apache Answerâ€‹

    1. Start Apache Answer with Docker Compose:

      curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/apache/incubator-answer/main/docker-compose.yaml | docker compose -p answer -f - up

      The default port for Answer is 9080. You can access it at http://localhost:9080.

    2. Install steps
      After you start the answer, you can follow the steps below to complete the initialization about the basic configuration.

      1. Choose the language
      2. Config database
        Answer supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQLite as the database backend. The smallest environment is SQLite, which does not require any additional configuration. If you want to use MySQL or PostgreSQL, you need to setup the database first and then configure the database connection in this step. Here we recommend using sqlite3 to complete your first experience.
      3. Create configuration file
        Click Next button to create the configuration file.
      4. Fill in basic information
        â€œSite URLâ€ is the browser address you will use to access answers after installation.
        Donâ€™t forget the admin Email and password.
      5. Complete
        Congratulations, you can click the done button to start your answer journey!

See also How to Migrate from SiteGround to Rad Web Hosting

Conclusionâ€‹

You now know how to install and run Apache Answer on Ubuntu VPS server.

å¤‡æ³¨

Originally published at https://blog.radwebhosting.com/install-and-run-apache-answer-on-ubuntu-vps/ on MAY 31, 2024

entry.title: Build a Safe and Respectful Community with Answer 1.3.1
entry.summary: Answer 1.3.1 brings a set of new features and enhancement to make your community a safe place where everyone can express themselves freely.
entry.content:
Build a thriving community, while making it a safe place for everyone to express themselves freely, is a dream and a challenge. Answer 1.3.1 is here for these two goals.

In this version, we add new tool for admin to define keyword lists to identify and review specific content beforehand, ensuring a safe space for everyone. Users can also mention the admin and moderator in comments of a post to seek response actively. New Captcha plugins are ready to safeguard your community.

Ready to upgrade? Leave us several minutes to dive in.

Whatâ€™s Newâ€‹

Keyword Censorship for Secure Communitiesâ€‹

Apache Answer is for open knowledge exchange and discussion respectfully. Keyword censorship helps achieve this by proactively filtering out offensive, discriminatory, or harassing content. It ensures a platform where everyone feels comfortable expressing themselves freely. Hereâ€™s how it works.

  1. Admin can develop a keyword list of the community to check or filter.
  2. Then, go Admin -> Plugin -> Review Basic where you can add these keywords in Review post keywords or Disallowed post keywords based on your need. One keyword or IP address per line. Scroll and click Save.
  3. Content, IP addresses, or browser identifiers that contain any of these words will be sent to the review queue or deleted. It will match the internal words. For example, if "alpha" is not allowed, then "Alphabet" is also not allowed.

This feature would allow administrators to review or filter out specific words or phrases, potentially creating safe spaces for younger audiences or communities with content restrictions.

Tag Moderators and Admin in Commentâ€‹

Now, you can mention moderator or admin in a comment of a post. As you type the first letter of the moderator or admin's username, a search bar will appear. Select the admin/moderator from the dropdown list for a faster response.

The moderator and admins will receive an email in their email box.

Shining on Social Platformsâ€‹

Social media meta tag is on the stage! Letâ€™s make your shared content appears more attractive on social media platforms. Social meta tags use the following defaults:

  • Title: the title of current page
  • Image: the logo of the site

Share it and donâ€™t forget to mention us on Twitter.

Improvements and Fixed Bugsâ€‹

Weâ€™ve got new plugins for you: Captcha Basic and Captcha Google V2. These two plugins enable or disable the CAPTCHA feature, allowing users to implement their CAPTCHA plugins, such as Google reCAPTCHA.

We also add auto-scroll for posting so that you can jump right to the blank space for you to edit it.

Find out more in our Release note.

Thanks to the Community.â€‹

This version is proudly presented by 8 contributors from the community, and they are: kumfo, hgaol, LinkinStars, robinv8, shuaishuai, sy-records, zahash, and prithvidasgupta.

We Love Feedbackâ€‹

We'd love your feedback! Share your thoughts on the latest releases, suggest features you need, or just send us messages. Please don't hesitate to reach out on X, Discord, GitHub, Meta Answer, or our mailing list.
